Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ Device() [1/3]

DeckLink::Device::Device ( )
inline

Default constructor.

This constructs a dummy Device that cannot actually be used for anything. It just serves to provide a default constructor.

◆ get_raw_device()

IDeckLink * DeckLink::Device::get_raw_device ( )

Get a raw pointer to the underlying device.

This allows you to call additional methods that may not be wrapped by the Device class.

Returns
A pointer to the device

Definition at line 14 of file device.cpp.

◆ load_attributes_interface()

void DeckLink::Device::load_attributes_interface ( ) const
protected

Load the AttributesInterface.

The Attributes interface is required to query attributes on the card and is used by the get_xxx_attribute family of functions.

Note
This function is marked const even though it really isn't. The _attributes_impl interface is lazy loaded so every time we call a *_attributes method we have to check if the interface has been loaded and if not load it. Since we want the get_*_attribute methods to be const we need this method to be const.

◆ parse_configuration_query_result()

template<typename AttributeType >
boost::optional< AttributeType > DeckLink::Device::parse_configuration_query_result ( HResult  result,
AttributeType  attribute_value 
) const
protected

Centralise handling of the AttributesInterface, ConfigurationInterface and StatusInterface return codes in a single place.

Template Parameters
AttributeTypeThe type of value to return (bool, int64_t, ...)
Parameters
resultThe return status of the GetXXX method
attribute_valueThe value to return if the returc code was good
Returns
The attribute_value if there were no errors
